Package Information
Kettle
  • Smart Voice & App Control: Supports Wi-Fi or Bluetooth connection via app for scheduling, checking, and adjusting the temperature anytime. When it is done boiling app will notify you. You can also voice control the electric tea kettle via Alexa, Google Assistant for more convenience.
  • To-the-degree Temp Control: The variable temperature electric kettle features 4 presets that can be set via the button or app. Set it between 104°F-212°F or DIY your mode. (Temp accuracy up to ±5.4°F) Ideal for beginners and professionals for brewing coffee or tea.
  • Digital Screen Display: The electric tea kettle has an LCD display in 360° swivel power base to view the target temperature and real-time temperature. Includes a side water window and an extra wide spout with an integrated filter for easy pouring.
  • Rapid Boil & Keep Warm: The electric kettle heats 7 cups / 1.7 liters of water in 5-7 minutes with 1500W power and can keep warm for up to 2 hours. Satisfy your water needs at any moment. Adjust the holding temperature time in the app.
  • Taste and Safety: Made with BPA-free food-grade 304 stainless steel, which is safer and more durable. With a trusted NTC temperature sensor, the kettle has automatic shut-off, dry boil protection and over-temperature protection.
  • Tips for Use: Only supports 120V 60HZ voltage and is connected to 2.4GHz Wi-Fi or Bluetooth (5G is not supported). This electric water kettle's attractive design and rich features make it a great gift for tea/coffee lovers.

      This is a modal window.

      Auto Shut Off & Safety

      The kettle with boil dry protection will automatically switch off its heating element when there is no water left.

      One-Touch Lid Opening

      Simply press the button, the lid automatically opens, making it more convenient to prevent scalding and splashing.

      Rapid Boil

      The electric kettle heats 7 cups / 1.7 liters of water in 5-7 minutes with 1500W power.

      Makes a Great Gift

      The kettle's attractive design and rich features make it a great gift for tea/coffee lovers.

      Tips for Use

      • Only supports 120V 60HZ voltage.
      • Connecting with 2.4GHz WiFi (No 5G support) or Bluetooth. It is recommended to turn on the Bluetooth location function of the phone to help with pairing and connection stability.
      • According to various altitudes, if the boiling water has boiled and stopped heating before the boiling point reaches 100 °C/212℉. Please don't worry that is a normal phenomenon.
      • Do not exceed the 1.7L MAX line when adding water.
      • It's normal if your tea kettle exposes spots or rust on the stainless steel bottom after the first use if using hard water. Cleaning cand descaling videos can be viewed at Listing, do not wipe kettle with sharp objects.
      • If you have both H7171 and H7170 kettles, please try not to mix the power base to avoid damage to the product.
      • Please only use this kettle to boil water, and brew your favorite tea, coffee, hot cocoa and oatmeal etc. in other cups or containers to avoid difficult cleaning and damage to the kettle.
      • When boiling water, it is normal for the kettle's exterior surface to get hot. Please do not touch the kettle's surface with your bare hands. Only use the kettle's handle, which is insulated and safe to grip.
      • The holding temperature range of the electric kettle is from 104℉ to 200℉, to prevent the evaporation of water caused by repeated boiling, the kettle can only hold the water temp at 200°F when the target temperature exceeds 200°F.

      Perfect Temperature for Perfect Life

      Top reviews from the United States

      • Lily
        5.0 out of 5 starsVerified Purchase
        So happy with this tea kettle
        Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2023
        We are new to tea drinking but as we learned more about different teas and their different temps, decided to look for an electric tea kettle with variable temp settings. The first one we purchased had many features we found useful but unfortunately it was not well made and... See more
        We are new to tea drinking but as we learned more about different teas and their different temps, decided to look for an electric tea kettle with variable temp settings. The first one we purchased had many features we found useful but unfortunately it was not well made and after going through 2 in 4 months, asked for a refund and started looking for a replacement.

        Here are the features we wanted and this one had them all:

        * Multiple Presets (has 4 presets, each can be reprogrammed to fit your temp needs)
        * Digital screen showing both current and set temp's
        * 1-degree incremental temperature control
        * Keep Warm of decent length (2 hrs in this case)
        * Boil Dry Safety Protection
        * Decent capacity (in this case 1.7 liters)
        * Decent wattage (in this case 1500 W)

        The base unit looks very attractive. The Push Button lid is easy to use and stays open while filling. The kettle also remembers the last temp used and will use that the next time (unless overridden) which is handy.

        Wasn't sure about the whole smart app feature as it seemed like overkill for a tea kettle, but have found it very handy and can be used to remote start the kettle so water is ready when you get to it. For most things you don't need the app and can do at the kettle, some things do require the app. We have it linked it in to Google so can just say "Turn on the tea kettle". We have not fully explored the app so I am sure there are other useful features as well.

        Some have mentioned the fill meter is hard to read since its behind the handle. To be honest, I don't even look at it any more. Once you've used it a few times, its easy to know about where to fill to. Some kettles we considered had a fill line bar sticking out that we really did not care for as you have to deal with it when cleaning so the fill being behind the handle is less an issue.

        I do have one issue with this kettle that I wish were different. Its not enough to take it to 4 stars, but I wish they had not gone this route. For the higher temps, the Keep Warm feature is a bit odd. It IMMEDIATELY kicks in as soon as the water reaches the desired temp. The problem is that the highest Keep Warm temp is 200 degrees - the reason is so that it doesn't boil for 2 hours which I totally understand. But practically its a bit irritating. So if you do say black tea at 212 degrees, just as soon as it hits 212 degrees it goes into Keep Warm mode and starts cooling off to 200 degrees. So unless you are standing next to the pot at that time with everything ready for the water, the temp will be much lower when you are ready to use it. There does not seem to be an easy way to get the temp back up (I tried customer support but they did not seem to understand the issue). I either have to use the app to get it to reheat or turn it off and back on to cancel the Keep Warm and get it heating again. My suggestion if they are reading this is a Hold time of 5 or 10 minutes before it goes into Keep Warm mode.

        As I said, its an irritant. but I can live with it; the other features more than make up for this one shortcoming. I am truly happy with the kettle and highly recommend it.
        49 people found this helpful

      • Michael
        5.0 out of 5 starsVerified Purchase
        Wanted a networked kettle for a long time
        Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
        I've wanted a network connected kettle for a long time, but few are made sadly. I get the logistical concerns, not enough water or boiling it out could be a problem, but Govee seems to have worked around that by adding a water sensor. It still tells you not to start... See more
        I've wanted a network connected kettle for a long time, but few are made sadly. I get the logistical concerns, not enough water or boiling it out could be a problem, but Govee seems to have worked around that by adding a water sensor. It still tells you not to start it without water, but it should detect if there isn't water and stop heating.

        It has worked great for me and I just refill it after using it most of the time so it's ready to go. Functionally it's pretty simple, hit the on button, hit the mode button to cycle to the temp you want, use the +/- buttons to fine tune the temperature. That's if you are using it at the device. The beauty of this thing is I can sit in bed in the morning and use the app to turn it on before I get moving so it's ready for my coffee or tea by the time I get to the kitchen. Or better yet, I can schedule it to cut on the night before so the water is ready without me thinking about it in the morning. In the afternoons, on the way home, I can just access Google Assistant once I'm getting close and have it turn the kettle on. Once the water is ready, the kettle beeps and I get a notification on my phone, which is nice.

        Via the app, you can tweak the preset temperature names (name only matters in the app) and target temps. As well as flag a preset as being for baby formula, so it will boil the water, then cool down to the target temp. You can also turn keep warm on/off and adjust how long it stays warm (1, 1.5, and 2 hours). There is a brewing timer function in the app you can use to time your tea/coffee while you wait on it, though I normally use Alexa for that purpose. You can also adjust other settings, turning the beep on the kettle off for when water is ready, turning off the notification on your phone (separate options for these), and change your temperature units (F vs C).

        A couple things I wish were a little different. Small nitpick, but I can't tweak the target temperature on the kettle itself once it has started warming without pressing something else before pressing +/-. So if I start it heating to 212, then decide I'm just doing coffee and want to quickly tap - to bring it down to 175, I have to turn it off and back on first usually. The other thing that I would like to see is the ability to control this via the API, right now I can only do it via the Govee app (as of 8/18/2023), Alexa, and Google Assistant. I'd love for it to be exposed on their API so I could integrate it with home assistant.

        Overall I'm very happy with this kettle, it's kinda been a dream product forever.

        Thus is a solid implementation of a kettle. The app is a standout: simple, intuitive, reach feature set. Also connects works seamlessly with Alexa .

        Full 1.7l volume boils in 7 minutes, the minimum recommended volume of water 0.5l boils in just over 2 minutes.

        The lid is made of plastic! So you will notice smell, but I’d say it is not a concern since the lid does not come into contact with boiling water.

        It’s up to you to determine if these features worth $80 to you.

      • D H
        1.0 out of 5 starsVerified Purchase
        Second Unit.. Dead
        Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2024
        I should have learned my lesson when the first one died shortly after buying it. Given the glowing reviews, I thought maybe I just had a rare bad unit, so I got another one. 8 months later and it's pretty much dead. It heats up but after you pick the kettle... See more
        I should have learned my lesson when the first one died shortly after buying it. Given the glowing reviews, I thought maybe I just had a rare bad unit, so I got another one.

        8 months later and it's pretty much dead. It heats up but after you pick the kettle up (to pour water) and then put it back on the base the display goes off and a red light shows around the power button. Unplugging the unit for 10 seconds, plugging it back in, and hitting power seems to get it back working, but this is how the last one failed too. That one ended with the unit not turning on at all.

        I wish this kettle would have lasted. The features on it are amazing. Being a smart device, I was able to integrate it into Home Assistant and have an automation where when I turn my watch off of sleep mode in the morning, the kettle turns on automatically.

        The stainless steel is great - no fear about ingesting plastic (although there is a small plastic window to see the water level, but I'm not too concerned given its size). When it inevitably gets scale build up, putting white vinegar/water mix in and boiling it gets it cleaned quickly - just rinse a few times with water afterwards so your coffee/tea doesn't taste like vinegar).

        Two negatives (besides it failing far too quickly):

        1. Needs to be insulated - aside from it also being safer to handle, being insulted will conserve energy and prevent needless on/off cycles prolonging the heating element and electronics. We get more efficient lights, appliances etc - at this day and age, why have an uninsulated kettle that unnecessarily wastes energy?

        2. Water level window - when filling up with water, the location of the window to see how much water is in it is blocked by your hand. It should be slightly offset from the handle, perhaps one on each side of the handle are (for right & left hands)

        Bottom line - great features, but have to recommend everyone avoid because of premature failure. First one died in a few weeks, second lasted only 8 months - at $90, it should last for years.
